channel.title: Need help Portforward with Belkin Router?
channel.description:
Alright guys, I've been looking at so many tutorials, None have succeeded, I don't know what i'm doing wrong so i've came to you guys for help.
Alright my Virtual servers set-up
[IMG]http://i53.tinypic.com/2h2r0qd.png[/img]
Then my computer firewall, I've uninstalled Norton Security, and turned off windows defender, And disabed Windows firewall
[IMG]http://i55.tinypic.com/2cih83m.png[/img]
Then comes the no-ip... I've made the host as "jalix.no-ip.org"
[IMG]http://i53.tinypic.com/2l9k579.png[/img]
*My IPV4 IS STATIC!*
I've also went to, [url=http://www.canyouseeme.org]www.canyouseeme.org[/url] i've checked the port "43594" and the error i'm establishing is: Connection timed out Can someone please tell me what i'm doing wrong? I've been trying so hard for months and never accomplished... Thankyou. <3

item.title: Need help Portforward with Belkin Router?
item.dc:creator: @Toxic95 Toxic95
item.description:
@Toxic95 wrote:

It’s easy. Just do like you were, just make sure you apply changes.

item.title: Need help Portforward with Belkin Router?
item.dc:creator: @communitycoder communitycoder
item.description:
@communitycoder wrote:

Thanks bud, But yes it’s static, and nope it’s not working… I just don’t understand what i’m doing wrong, I’ve went to www.portforward.com, followed the tut and didn’t work:l

Read full topic
item.source: Need help Portforward with Belkin Router?

item.title: Need help Portforward with Belkin Router?
item.dc:creator: @Strafe Strafe
item.description:
@Strafe wrote:

The first thing I would think of is that your ip wasn’t static, but you said you did that. IF it actually is static then did you check to make sure that your static ip is also set to 192.168.2.5 I remember back when i first made a private server that was my problem. I had my ip in the router set to 192.168.0.11 instead of 192.168.0.10. The only other thing I can think of is that where it says TCP if your router has the option of “Both” or TCP/UDP change it to that. Otherwise just create a second one is possible. (RSPS1 43594-43594 UDP 192.168.2.5 43594-43594) If this still doesn’t remedy the problem I’m not sure what the problem is… You could try from the beginning, and If you haven’t tried using this site for tutorials before it worked well for me portforward.com Sorry if this doesn’t help your problem. If it’s not something with your static ip, then I’m not sure why the port would be closed it looks like you forwarded correctly, but I don’t have a Belkin so I’m not entirely sure.

-Strafe

Read full topic
item.source: Need help Portforward with Belkin Router?
